message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using substitution method: 

3x + 2y = 10

4x - 5y = -9
message_2:
First, we will solve one of the equations for one variable. Let's solve the first equation for x:

3x + 2y = 10

3x = 10 - 2y

x = (10 - 2y) / 3

Now we will substitute this expression for x into the second equation:

4x - 5y = -9

4((10 - 2y) / 3) - 5y = -9

Now we will solve for y:

(40 - 8y) / 3 - 5y = -9

Multiply both sides by 3 to get rid of the fraction:

40 - 8y - 15y = -27

Combine like terms:

-23y = -67

Divide by -23:

y = 67 / 23

y = 3

Now that we have the value of y, we can substitute it back into the expression for x:

x = (10 - 2y) / 3

x = (10 - 2(3)) / 3

x = (10 - 6) / 3

x = 4 / 3

So the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 4/3 and y = 3.
